trans-unit.source: An audience is a boolean expression made of criteria (variables) operators (“not”, “and” or “or”) and parenthesis.
trans-unit.target: An audience is a boolean expression made of criteria (variables) operators (“not”, “and” or “or”) and parenthesis.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, a set of filters can be added to an audience.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, a set of filters can be added to an audience.

trans-unit.source: If the boolean expression is true for a given device, and the device is not filtered, then the device is part of the audience.
trans-unit.target: If the boolean expression is true for a given device, and the device is not filtered, then the device is part of the audience.

trans-unit.source: An audience is represented by a JSON string.
trans-unit.target: An audience is represented by a JSON string.

trans-unit.source: The format is describes as follow:
trans-unit.target: The format is describes as follow:

trans-unit.source: The following sections describe the expressions, criteria, and filters of an audience.
trans-unit.target: The following sections describe the expressions, criteria, and filters of an audience.

trans-unit.source: The following is the expression language grammar in a pseudo Backus–Naur Form (BNF):
trans-unit.target: The following is the expression language grammar in a pseudo Backus–Naur Form (BNF):

trans-unit.source: Criterion names in the audience expression must start with a capital letter and can only contain alphanumeric (A-Z,a-z,0-9) and underscore (_) characters.
trans-unit.target: Criterion names in the audience expression must start with a capital letter and can only contain alphanumeric (A-Z,a-z,0-9) and underscore (_) characters.

trans-unit.source: String-based criterion such as Carrier name, Application version, Device manufacturer for instance support the wildcard characters ?
trans-unit.target: String-based criterion such as Carrier name, Application version, Device manufacturer for instance support the wildcard characters ?

trans-unit.source: To perform a single character wildcard matching use the ?
trans-unit.target: To perform a single character wildcard matching use the ?

trans-unit.source: For example, to match text or test you can use the string te?t.
trans-unit.target: For example, to match text or test you can use the string te?t.

trans-unit.source: To perform a multiple character wildcard search use the * symbol.
trans-unit.target: To perform a multiple character wildcard search use the * symbol.

trans-unit.source: For example, to match HTC Magic, HTC Desire or HTC Wildfire you can use the string HTC *.
trans-unit.target: For example, to match HTC Magic, HTC Desire or HTC Wildfire you can use the string HTC *.

trans-unit.source: All string-based criteria can be used to match users whose associated information is not available.
trans-unit.target: All string-based criteria can be used to match users whose associated information is not available.

trans-unit.source: Instead of the string value, you should use the null JSON value.
trans-unit.target: Instead of the string value, you should use the null JSON value.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following criterion will target users running on a device with an unknown carrier name:
trans-unit.target: For example, the following criterion will target users running on a device with an unknown carrier name:

trans-unit.source: You can apply the null JSON object as a value to set the criterion as ‘undefined’.
trans-unit.target: You can apply the null JSON object as a value to set the criterion as ‘undefined’.

trans-unit.target: Targeting people based on their carrier name.

trans-unit.source: Targeting people based on their carrier country.
trans-unit.target: Targeting people based on their carrier country.

trans-unit.source: Targeting people based on their firmware.
trans-unit.target: Targeting people based on their firmware.

trans-unit.source: Targeting people based on the device manufacturer.
trans-unit.target: Targeting people based on the device manufacturer.

trans-unit.source: Targeting people based on the device model.
trans-unit.target: Targeting people based on the device model.

trans-unit.source: Targeting people based on the version of the application they are using.
trans-unit.target: Targeting people based on the version of the application they are using.

trans-unit.source: Targeting people based on their network type.
trans-unit.target: Targeting people based on their network type.

trans-unit.source: Targeting people based on the locale of their phone.
trans-unit.target: Targeting people based on the locale of their phone.

trans-unit.source: Targeting people based on the screen resolution of their phone.
trans-unit.target: Targeting people based on the screen resolution of their phone.

trans-unit.source: Screen size using the following format width*x*Height.
trans-unit.target: Screen size using the following format width*x*Height.

trans-unit.source: Targeting people based on their last know area.
trans-unit.target: Targeting people based on their last know area.

trans-unit.source: Two character country code where the user is located (ISO 3166-1).
trans-unit.target: Two character country code where the user is located (ISO 3166-1).

trans-unit.source: An administrative region of the country, such as a state or province (optional).
trans-unit.target: An administrative region of the country, such as a state or province (optional).

trans-unit.source: A locality within the administrative region, such as a town or city (optional).
trans-unit.target: A locality within the administrative region, such as a town or city (optional).

trans-unit.source: Targeting people based on a specific region.
trans-unit.target: Targeting people based on a specific region.

trans-unit.source: A center point (defined by a latitude and longitude) and a radius form the boundary for the region.
trans-unit.target: A center point (defined by a latitude and longitude) and a radius form the boundary for the region.

trans-unit.source: This criterion will be met when the user crosses the boundaries of the region.
trans-unit.target: This criterion will be met when the user crosses the boundaries of the region.

trans-unit.source: The latitude of the central point of the region.
trans-unit.target: The latitude of the central point of the region.

trans-unit.source: The longitude of the central point of the region.
trans-unit.target: The longitude of the central point of the region.

trans-unit.source: The radius of the central point of the region, in meters.
trans-unit.target: The radius of the central point of the region, in meters.

trans-unit.source: Number of minutes before device location is considered to be expired.
trans-unit.target: Number of minutes before device location is considered to be expired.

trans-unit.source: Targeting people who received an announcement.
trans-unit.target: Targeting people who received an announcement.

trans-unit.source: The unique identifier of the announcement.
trans-unit.target: The unique identifier of the announcement.

trans-unit.source: Action that was performed on the announcement.
trans-unit.target: Action that was performed on the announcement.

trans-unit.target: Targeting people who received a poll.

trans-unit.source: The unique identifier of the poll.
trans-unit.target: The unique identifier of the poll.

trans-unit.source: Action that was performed on the poll.
trans-unit.target: Action that was performed on the poll.

trans-unit.source: Targeting people who answered X to a given question.
trans-unit.target: Targeting people who answered X to a given question.

trans-unit.source: The unique identifier of the poll.
trans-unit.target: The unique identifier of the poll.

trans-unit.source: The unique identifier of the choice.
trans-unit.target: The unique identifier of the choice.

trans-unit.source: Targeting people who received a data push.
trans-unit.target: Targeting people who received a data push.

trans-unit.source: The unique identifier of the data push.
trans-unit.target: The unique identifier of the data push.

trans-unit.source: Action that was performed on the data push (action depends on the return value in the callbacks you declared in the client code).
trans-unit.target: Action that was performed on the data push (action depends on the return value in the callbacks you declared in the client code).

trans-unit.source: Install tracking criteria can only be used if the application is integrated with the tracking module.
trans-unit.target: Install tracking criteria can only be used if the application is integrated with the tracking module.

trans-unit.target: You can apply the null JSON object as a value to set the criterion as ‘undefined’.

trans-unit.target: Targeting people based on their gender (male or female).

trans-unit.target: Targeting people based on their birth date.

trans-unit.source: A relational operator must be used to compare dates.
trans-unit.target: A relational operator must be used to compare dates.

trans-unit.source: An absolute date using CCYY-MM-DD) format (e.g. 1969-12-07 stands for 7 Dec 1969)
trans-unit.target: An absolute date using CCYY-MM-DD) format (e.g. 1969-12-07 stands for 7 Dec 1969)

trans-unit.source: An offset in days relative to the current day (TODAY + value).
trans-unit.target: An offset in days relative to the current day (TODAY + value).

trans-unit.source: Relational operator: EQ (equal to), LT (less than), GT (greater than), LE (less than or equal to) or GE (greater than or equal to).
trans-unit.target: Relational operator: EQ (equal to), LT (less than), GT (greater than), LE (less than or equal to) or GE (greater than or equal to).

trans-unit.target: This information is specific to your application and must be registered in its settings page.

trans-unit.target: Engage only a subset of the users
